website_summaries.verdict: The Wilton 3-Tier chocolate fountain has the capacity to handle birthday parties and wedding receptions.  Relatively silent operation and delivers a generous cascade of product for multiple users.
pros: Large 4 pound capacity, chocolate heats in stainless steel basin
cons: Parts must be assembled precisely to avoid performance problems
Some users report temperature control issues

customer_reviews.title: Fun, works very well
customer_reviews.text: Very happy we bought this chocolate fountain! Easy setup, works perfectly, we simply followed the directions! Takes a little time to clean, no biggie though. Used it today for our daughters bday party, will use it at all events going forward! It was running a little slow at first, we just turned it back to warm, then turned the pump back on a few seconds later, and it was flowing perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I have owned one of these before, and my other one worked perfect for years until it finally died on me last year. I deided to purchase this one due to my previous positive experience. I followed the instructions to a T, and I bought the correct chocolate. The melted chocolate would not stay warm in the fountain, and quickly turned into a chunky, hard, mess. I got this for an event, so I was very disappointed when it would not work. I brought it home and tried a few more times to get it to work, but no luck. Very disappointed, and now I have to buy a new one. Would like my money back:(
customer_reviews.author: VBplayer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Update. We used this chocolate fountain for a total of 4 times, followed directions exactly and it just stopped working in the middle of our New Years Eve party. I had to stop in the middle of everything and clean it out so the chocolate wouldn't get hard. Not happy... it should have lasted longer than that!
customer_reviews.author: MrsLawver

customer_reviews.title: So much FUN!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a birthday celebration. It was a huge hit. I bought the chocolate from bed , bath and beyond. Heated up the chocolate first and poured into the fountain. 2 bags .... this fountain was on for 3 hours nonstop and was the hit of the party. Before i turned it off I dipped all The items and just made a huge plate to eat later . I used strawberries, grapes, marshmallows, nutter butter, pretzels. Highly recommend! 😍💕😍
customer_reviews.author: anne galovich

customer_reviews.title: Chocolate galore!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked amazing! Bought it from warehouse deals and other than it was opened there was nothing wrong with it. Just cheaper! You do need two bags of chocolate to get it looking like a beautiful flow. (Melt first then pour in fountain) great party addition
customer_reviews.author: Norma I. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great showpiece for a large gathering
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son’s wedding reception. Looked and worked great. BIG hit at the dessert table. Good things to know: you need to melt the chocolate ahead of time so plan for that. (Also, wear a big apron if you are in your wedding clothes) Okay outside unless it’s windy (I’m sure you can envision that result). The one thing I didn’t foresee was how kids would use it. More than possible that melted chocolate will decorate the tablecloth, other desserts, the wall, the floor. REQUIRE that they be accompanied by an adult!! It was very easy to clean afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: This fountain MADE the whole party!
customer_reviews.text: I had a fall party for our youth group girls and they went crazy for this fountain! Small expense for big “wow factor”! I added 4 lbs of chocolate and will do at least 5 lbs next time to keep it flowing nicely even after they devour it! ;) I heated chocolate over double broiler on stove then poured in the fountain. Make sure you don’t get ANY water in the chocolate! We had strawberries, bananas, marshmallow, pretzel and nutter butter cookies to dip in the fountain :)
customer_reviews.author: Carebear97

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy - it does not work
customer_reviews.text: This fountain only worked 2 times and the third time splashed all around and it was not due to the viscosity of the chocolate but something in its design is flawed. It was my bosses' birthday thus it made it memorable but we had to clean for three hours windows, walls, carpets plus everyone was full of chocolate. Otherwise it is a nice looking machine easy to assemble and operate but does not function...
customer_reviews.author: Ioana

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy
customer_reviews.text: Came well packaged and in good time. Easy set up and break down which allows for convenient cleaning. I was worried about the fact that it's plastic and not metal but the fountain works great. Definitely follow instructions for adding vegetable oil to help consistency of chocolate and allow for easier flow through machine. Kept the chocolate warm the whole time, not messy, and even worked well with a half batch.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for house parties
customer_reviews.text: The machine worked perfectly. I made sure to follow all the instructions and use the recommended chocolate. The fountain was running for 4 hours with no problem. As soon as I turned it off, I removed all the remaining chocolate and start washing the pieces in hot water. I was able to clean it in less than 15 mins.
customer_reviews.author: MafeArango

customer_reviews.title: Wedding Fail
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for my daughter's wedding. The assembly was easy. I ordered the Wilton chocolate to go with it. Everything started out great but about 10 minutes into the reception it stopped working. That was about 45 minutes after we started the fountain. My daughter's last name was changing to DiOrio and so we had purchase the fountain to set up a DiOrio Bar "The Oreo bar". It obviously did not go as planned.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Young

customer_reviews.title: melt the chocolate thoroughly
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT start the pump before the chocolate is FULLY melted ... I had someone turn the pump on when there were still small unmelted pieces of chocolate ... my guess is a chunk of chocolate plugged the pump, pressure built up, the center spout came apart from the pressure, and BOOM chocolate spewed EVERYWHERE. We ended up finishing the melting of the chocolate in the microwave. Worked like a charm after that and was quite a success!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great center piece
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly! Easy to assemble, turned to warm for 10 min (while I melted chocolate in a bowl in the microwave), added melted chocolate and switched on. Fountain was definitely the center piece. Everyone was very excited and it smelled amazing! I would recommend using 6-8 lbs of chocolate. I used 4 and it was barely enough. Once the chocolate starts moving up the fountain and people start wasting it goes empty quickly. I recommend melting chocolate in a bowl, if you use the bag there is a lot of waste in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: The fountain worked fine, but it was very hard to clean, I wouldn't recommend this product just because of the cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen A. Otjens

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. But willing to try again.
customer_reviews.text: This needs to say in bold print to MELT ALL CHOCOLATE BEFORE ADDING TO A RUNNING MACHINE. I added some unmelted bits I’m thinking they got stuck in the auger, which stopped moving, as the bit(s) melted the auger released and chocolate spun out everywhere! What a mess-cleaning fees from the venue-kids with stained clothes and my display covered in a chocolate mess. We had a chocolate bowl. I still don’t know if that is exactly what happened, but it spun out twice so I took it apart. In hindsight, I think that’s what happened. I didn’t have access to a microwave to melt the chocolate before adding.
customer_reviews.author: Diana A. Duarte

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions actually show to put the chocolate in the machine and melt it with the warmer, but I melted in microwave first as the machine was heating up. Poured the chocolate in and hit the flow switch and it worked perfectly! I used 4lbs of dark chocolate made for fountains and it flowed very smoothly. Turn the machine off for about 2 hours and left it...came back and turned it back on and the chocolate melted and started to flow just like the first time. Very impressed how easy it is to use and how great it works. Easy to clean as well as it all comes apart. would highly recommend this unit
customer_reviews.author: Kenny P

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: it didn't work at all!! waste of money! was so embarrassing at my daughter's birthday when I had to remove it from off the table. I read some of the reviews that complained about it but still took a chance!! A total waste!!
customer_reviews.author: jimi jack

customer_reviews.title: What would have made it greater.
customer_reviews.text: Your product worked beautifully; however, it would have been nice to have more detailed step-by-step directions as well as answers to certain questions such as: how do I make clean-up easier/faster (it takes forever); how long can you leave the device on/running; what is the best thing to do with any leftover chocolate. I ended up asking numerous friends for information regarding their experiences with chocolate fountains. Many had NO experience, other than taking advantage of using them at events/parties.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Dawson

customer_reviews.title: ****product deception**** you  DO have to melt the chocolate with this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these because the video showed no melting chocolate first like the other chocolate fountain demo's on line. And we needed them for a wedding. No melting chocolate would of saved a lot of time and mess. . So I thought it was worth the extra money that these chocolate fountains cost. HOWEVER, that video was very deceptive! You still have to melt the chocolate. And it didn't do anything better than any one of the other brands of chocolate fountains that we bought. So if I could go back. I would of bought ALL cheaper chocolate fountains. It still works. The same as the cheaper ones worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this fountain
customer_reviews.text: Bought this fountain for a gender reveal party. The fountain was easy to set up and flowed beautifully during the party. The fountain was a hit during the party. I also used the Wilton chocolate which was easily melted in the bag and poured into the fountain. Clean up was messy but I think it will be with any fountain. Plan on cleaning up as soon as it is turned off.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley Cantrelle

customer_reviews.title: It was a hit!
customer_reviews.text: Had a graduation open house with about 50 ppl. I left extra chocolate on low in a double boiler and added whenever it was low. This little guy kept on pumping. It was a hit! I bought the recommended Wilton choc bags and everyone raved about how yummy it was. This fountain is going to be part of our celebrations for a long time to come!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: This fountain did not work. I used it for my daughters wedding reception and guests had to dip items into the well of the fountain because it wouldn't pump the chocolate through it. I returned it for a new one but have not had the opportunity to use it again. Hopefully for the family Christmas party I will get another chance to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Kalynn

customer_reviews.title: It didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter birthday party. It didn’t work. The kids we’re so sad. I couldn’t return it. Due to not making the deadline. So I’m stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nj

customer_reviews.title: Lumpy Chocolate (does not heat well)
customer_reviews.text: I bough this for my son's baptismal, thinking it would be a nice touch to our candy table. We were inside an auditorium which was a bit drafty and maybe that's why the fountain couldn't keep the chocolate melted. I followed the instructions and even looked at the other reviews which recommend you melt the chocolate before you add it to the machine, but still the fountain did not work. Worst part is that we kept tryiung to change the chocolate with new melted chocolate but still was not enough to get the thing to work. I will give it a second shot and update the review if the thing works.
customer_reviews.author: RAIN ROD

customer_reviews.title: Love it...With reservation
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble and operate and clean up. Worked flawlessly. Why the rating? There was a lot of wasted chocolate. It took 4 pounds to form a fountain, but with 2 pounds it barely was more of a dripping fountain. Still love it! Just have to accept the waste factor. So only to use for very special occasions.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kohler

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this chocolate fountain! It is very easy to use and chocolate is amazing when it’s running down! I am very pleased! FYI: Make sure the chocolate of choice is for a chocolate fountain because there are chocolate melts that are not for chocolate FOUNTAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Corina

customer_reviews.title: very successful for party
customer_reviews.text: once I got it level the chocolate flowed very smoothly all around the tiers. Quick & easy to assemble. As expected cleanup was tricky as you have to arrange & plan your attack. It was used at our Granddaughters graduation party & was the flowing chocolate with strawberries, bananas, marshmallows, etc. , enjoyed by all. Would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Ordered to use at my bridal shower but it never worked. Plugged it up and nothing .
customer_reviews.author: ACoupe24

customer_reviews.title: Great product for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Easter Sunday for something different and with peanut allergies and celiac disease, I was excited to try this fountain! The set up was super easy and it worked perfectly! I was worried about the clean up, but it was so easy to clean! I would highly recommend this product!! My teenagers said it was the best dessert! Was it perfect for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: weimmom2

customer_reviews.title: Flexible but hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Overall I used this product once and I realized that once the chocolate settles down, this becomes one thick mound of layers that is extremely hard to clean. otherwise, overall it functions OK. I wish the warmer temperature should be in ON mode even after the rotor is not moving.
customer_reviews.author: Techno Buyer

customer_reviews.title: A Party Hit
customer_reviews.text: I chimed the wine glass to silence my guests and turned it on. Expressions of the delight and amazement filled the room. The table where it sat was never empty as people dipped "everything" into this delicious warmed chocolate.
customer_reviews.author: CDB

customer_reviews.title: Good for large parties
customer_reviews.text: People love it because it’s chocolate. It’s a bit messy to clean. The chocolate does not flow evenly over the tiers as shown in the picture. It uses four pounds of chocolate so keep that in mind. As it’s suited for a large party or you’ll have a lot of waste. I’m not sure if you can save and reheat the extra chocolate. I dumped it out.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene S.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my
customer_reviews.text: First time using my new Wilton Chocolate fountain, we had a valentine dance for about 80 people it was a hit. I bought the Sephra milk chocolate from Amazon too, they worked well together. We dipped strawberries, rice krispie treats, marshmallows and bananas. Rice krispies were the first gone. Clean up was a bit messy. When finished we had to use damp paper towels to remove all the chocolate first then wash and rinse. It all work out well. Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly easy!
customer_reviews.text: What a relief it was to find out how easy this is to set up, use and clean. I did purchase the wilton wafers that are ready to use, however, due to the price, I would be anxious to try melting regular chocolate and adding the oil to see how that turns out. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great buy - made a great impression
customer_reviews.text: The fountain worked as advertised. It is very important to make sure that it is level when running so you get the full effect of the 'waterfall' of chocolate. One drawback is that when chocolate level was down a little bit, the waterfall didn't really flow past the first tier. It was a bit of a challenge to clean. The base and small crevices in the fountain parts were especially challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Bonina

customer_reviews.title: good deal. but, are you going to use it again?
customer_reviews.text: Update 2/21. Wow, used this for friend's birthday. While fun and tasty, a pain to clean! And make sure you don't clog your drains with hardened chocolate. I'm going to have someone else clean it next time... On the plus side, it costs less to buy than to rent. Helped buy this for sister's wedding. apparently it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: The best hit at my 8yr old daughter's birthday! Forget the petting zoo, jumpers, etc. The more items you offer to dip in the chocolate fountain the better! Think lazy Susan and veggies, chips, takis, berries... and long toothpicks! Kids and adults love it equally!!
customer_reviews.author: SB Investor

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work at all
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd chocolate fountain. The first one worked about 20 minutes, and this one never worked. I bought the special chocolate to use with it, and it sputtered and had to be turned off so that we didn’t have a kitchen/living room fill of chocolate. It’s a shame. It was for a baby shower that was amazing otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Moser

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and use
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! a total crowd pleaser. Eady to assemble, clean, and use. To clean, i just filled the sink with hot water and soap, let it soak for 5 min then shook under the water to clwan! Such a breeze! I need to find more excuses to use it! Its great!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I thought of the idea last minute and it came just in time for my party. Huge hit. Easy set up. I didn't even realize it would melt the chocholate. I melted it on the stove then I pored itinto the machine. I might just get another one for cheese!
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, with a huge wow factor
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't exactly call it easy to clean. Straightforward to clean, but was a bit of a pain. However, the wow factor was huge. It worked extremely well and was worth the price. Everyone at our gathering loved it.
customer_reviews.author: B.D.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT!!!! BUY  -1 Rating
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT!!!!!! WASTE YOUR MONEY. I PURCHASED THIS FOR MY DAUGHTER'S 12TH BIRTHDAY PARTY. WENT TO SET IT UP AT THE PARK WITH HER FRIENDS, MELTED THE CHOCOLATE, POURED IT IN THE FOUNTAIN, IT STARTED UP ANNNNDD 2-3 MINUTES LATER THE MOTOR STOPPED!!!!!! RUINED MY DAUGHTERS PARTY😭😭
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adds glamour to the dessert table
customer_reviews.text: No issues or problems with it. We did use the Wilton chocolate discs, so we didn't have to add any oil to the mix. Everyone loved it as it was a big hit with strawberries, marshmallows, bananas, and graham crackers. A good buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Silenteagle

customer_reviews.title: A family tradition
customer_reviews.text: We go one of these several years ago for our grandaughters. They used it so much it finally just pooped out. Time for a new one. And they like this one better than the first.
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: GrandKids Loved It!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. Followed the directions for melting chocolate and chocolate was awesome. Ran for hours without an issue. A little noise but not much. BIG hit with the GrandKids! Happy with the purchase. Definitely would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Janet M. Bourne

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is actually easy to assemble and to clean afterwards. It does use quite a bit of chocolate (4lbs) and you should have another lb ready if you have a lot of people using it. The kids loved it
customer_reviews.author: Amanda McCarty

customer_reviews.title: and it was perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This was the belle of the ball. Hosted a party with 20+ kids and only needed one bag of chocolate with this. Make sure you read all instructions, Especially the ones saying not to run the fountain, then turn it off, then try to run it again. That was a mess to clean. It worked so well, and the chocolate ran smoothly. Left it running for about 1.5 hours, and it was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Shi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to melt the chocolate just watch for dropped pretzels
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my daughter’s wedding. It was terrific. I stirred the Wilton chocolate as it melted in the bowl of the fountain. It worked better than in the microwave. I don’t think that was recommended, but I kept stirring until it all melted before I turned on the auger. It was super easy that way. The only reason I didn’t give it a perfect rating is because a pretzel was dropped and clogged it which caused it to spit chocolate everywhere halfway through the reception. I just think there has to be a piece that could’ve been in place to prevent that. It made a funny memory I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Hekel

customer_reviews.title: When the fountain is on the warmer is not causing chocolate to harden.
customer_reviews.text: When the fountain is on the warmer is not, causing chocolate to harden. Chocolate becomes hard when moving up the fountain clogging the fountain. Does not work. I refuse to add a ton of oil to keep the chocolate liquid enough to flow at room temperature.
customer_reviews.author: John Grissam

customer_reviews.title: Super cool/ worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I think this is so far the best purchase I’ve ever made on Amazon (and I been buying stuff here since 2016-2017) this was the life of the party, worked all night (4 hrs), super easy to put together... this is a MUST HAVE for any party or special occasions ! The way I think about is you buy it once and use it forever!! Only thing is you’ll need 4-5 pounds of chocolate to cover the whole machine and make it look nicer! I only had 4 pounds which was enough for the guests and I wish I would’ve done 5 pounds instead!
customer_reviews.author: Lisselot

customer_reviews.title: Great fountain, but clean it immediately!
customer_reviews.text: This fountain works really well - but DO NOT let the chocolate harden before cleaning!!! I love bringing it to school parties. A spread of nut free “dippers” is great! Strawberries, pretzels, Rice Krispie treats, marshmallows... a huge hit!
customer_reviews.author: Jen Van

customer_reviews.title: Great awesome love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG this was a big hit at my daughters graduation party and yes the High school kids thought it was cool! Thank you for making my party a hit!! Everything worked great easy to put together, the only hard part was cleaning it afterwards but just use hot soapy water and you will do fine.
customer_reviews.author: KIM

customer_reviews.title: Fancy party addition
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a party. Seems to use more than 4lbs of chocolate once it starts running. Make sure it's level before melting it and adding chocolate.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Is made of plastic some careful with it. We dropped it and top broke off, it still works, and I think I can glue it back. Everyone enjoyed the chocolate! Pretty easy to clean, but you will have plenty left in unit once it stops flowing so need to store in fridge till next time.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores A Fox

customer_reviews.title: Bogy
customer_reviews.text: Works better if u put in 4 lbs of chocolate. Must buy their chocolates or a melting chocolate for best cascade. We used chocolate chips then u must add a lot of oil for it to be smooth. Found it to large for our size of 4 people.
customer_reviews.author: MadiInTheMountains

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chocolate fountain for my daughter's 13th "Sweets" Birthday party. It was a hit with everyone!! We used rice Krispy treats, strawberries and marshmallows. I used it just as instructed. I melted the chocolate first and kept the chocolate in the bottom of the fountain stirred occasionally to keep it running smoothly. It was very easy to assemble and dis-assemble, and it was very easy to clean. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Edwards

customer_reviews.title: You don’t know until it’s flowing
customer_reviews.text: This fountain was a good product but it’s hard to know if it’s assembled correctly until the chocolate is already in and flowing and at that point you can’t go back and adjust it. I kinda liked it but I’ll probably put it up for resale (I’m a party planner)
customer_reviews.author: Corey Pratt

customer_reviews.title: I would like to thank Micheal C for his quick assistance in rectifying my problem.
customer_reviews.text: Hello and good morning to the Amazon Team. I would like to send a heart full thanks for my package I received. I did receive my package the (Wilton Chocolate Pro Fountain) and I am very pleased with it. Thanks team Amazon and continue doing the good work.
customer_reviews.author: Me, I & I

customer_reviews.title: Party pleaser!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! I purchased the Wilton fountain chocolate melts to go with this and they tasted wonderful. Everyone loved it! Read all the directions carefully to the fountain and the chocolate. If you do it right it will turn out fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Shughes

customer_reviews.title: Was not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a good model, easy to put together but didn't work that well for the price. The plastic parts were so HARD to clean. Preferred my metal one I used to have.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable at all!
customer_reviews.text: Even though we were looking forward to using this fountain for our son's graduation party, we were very disappointed when this chocolate fountain dies on us only 20 minutes after turning it on! My wife and i love to shop on Amazon and I have to admit never did we ever buy something that was not good quality. Hopefully, that item was our first and last let down from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Roy

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for my son’s graduation party. Worked great! Have to be careful that no food chunks get into the chocolate- will clog the auger... overall super happy with this and can’t wait to use it again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A fountain that works!
customer_reviews.text: We had another brand (cheaper) that we ended up throwing away. This worked perfectly with 2 bags of chocolate. The extra benefit is that compared to our old one, this was very easy to clean. We were have to save and reuse the leftover chocolate saving a bunch of $.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: It didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble. Easy to clean. The problem......when I turned it on it it sprayed chocolate everywhere as if it was on a high speed. Sadly, I purchased this in November and “saved” it til my daughters wedding shower in March .......made a huge mess and now I can’t exchange or return it. Very disappointed. I decided to attempt it again at home. Did the same exact thing. A huge huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Warner

customer_reviews.title: FOUNTAIN DID NOT WORK FOR 10 MINUTES
customer_reviews.text: Very Very Unhappy! I followed all the directions and the fountain did not work for even 10 minutes. Do not buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not working  New Chocolate Fountain
customer_reviews.text: This chocolate fountain spewed chocolate all over the lady serving at our Preschool Graduation. The chocolate covered the floor and it was a hot mess. Needless to say, I have contacted Amazon and they have passed me to Wilton.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Fahy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a wedding. It was a total hit. Made sure to purchase the Wilton chocolate which made it way easier to use. No mixing in oil. It takes quite a bit of chocolate to start up and keep it running. So although it’s fairly easy to clean, quite a bit of chocolate is discarded. Used a fondue pot for smaller occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: favorite at any party
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up, easy to clean, easy to use. My days of wondering what to bring to parties is long gone, this simplifies life

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment and put a damper on the event as the ...
customer_reviews.text: We were never able to get it to work; even with purchasing the right chocolate and operating according to instructions. Nor were we able to get in contact with customer service. Huge disappointment and put a damper on the event as the fountain was what the dessert bar was centered around.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Nowlin

customer_reviews.title: Too cool to work well
customer_reviews.text: First time use was for a wedding. You really have to get the chocolate hot and very liquid before putting it in the fountain. Guests finally started dipping into warmed bowl of chocolate.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Or Pj Low

customer_reviews.title: Love love love saves me so much $$
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 and by FAR my FAVORITE purchase of 2020. I've used it several times for cheese and chocolate and it's works amazing and I can entertain for $20 to $40
customer_reviews.author: NICOLE

customer_reviews.title: Wilton chocolate Pro fountain works great
customer_reviews.text: It works great! We used the Wilton chocolate fondue (4lbs) and the assembly and clean up was easy!! We preheated for ten minutes as recommended and added the chocolate fondue once I melted it and it ran smoothly the whole time it was on
customer_reviews.author: The Cobb Crew

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this!!!
customer_reviews.text: This quit working after we used it one time. The second time we used it the heating element stopped working & the fountain was gloppy & disgusting. Unfortunately the return window is closed & I am going to throw this useless bit in the rubbish!

product_meta.title: Wilton Chocolate Pro Chocolate Fountain - Chocolate Fondue Fountain, 4 lb. Capacity
product_meta.description: Your party guests will love being able to dip their own desserts with the Wilton Chocolate Pro Fountain. The chocolate fondue fountain uses four pounds of chocolate and keeps it flowing so you can make chocolate covered strawberries, marshmallows, and pretzels. Discover a fun way to serve dessert at wedding showers and receptions, holiday parties, and more! Do not place on or near a hot gas or electric burner, or in a heated oven
feature_bullets: The Chocolate Pro Fountain will give party guests hours of dessert dipping fun
Unique bowl design keeps chocolate melted and flowing while three canopies are perfectly spaced for easy dipping and the center tube disassembles for quick cleanup
16 inches (40.6 centimeter) tall. Adjustable feet with bubble level to keep the fountain steady
Holds 4 pounds (1.8 kilogram) of melted chocolate
Never immerse electrical unit in water, removable components are dishwasher safe. Processes peanuts, tree nuts, soy and wheat
